result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State's Victim Identification Key to Supplement the Criminal Complaint
State's Victim Identification Key to Supplement the Criminal Complaint

1:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marshall D Ravenhorst appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail. Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Tomtschik - rcvd complaint. waive reading.
State - asking $500 cash bond. No possession of any firearms. 
Atty Tomtschik - no objection to bond conditions. Asks for sign bond. Unsure if any cash can be posted.
Court - orders $1,000 sign bond. No possession of any firearms. 
Atty Tomtschik - waives time limits for prelim
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
